review: Good points: -service was pretty good tonight -Food was good (minus the sprouts) Some bad points: -bar area smelled bad like old mixers -bar top was pretty dirty -new brussel sprouts side was gross. I wouldn't order again -I ordered a draft Miller Lite but they were out After several very bad service experiences over our last few visits I had sworn I would not be coming back. It's always at the bar and always the same girl whose been there forever. She's really impressively bad at her job. Anyway, it was Christmas Day and it was the only place open so we had no choice unless we were going to go grocery shopping and cook last minute (not going to happen) so we decided to try one more time. It was super busy but we found a spot at the bar. We had 2 male bartenders and they were great even though they had to run there ass off to keep up. Put them on the schedule more!

Let's just say their total disregard for customer service has cost them a customer. And as many of my friends that I can relate my experience to. And how about a decor update. At least fix the hole in the wall. Just an FYI it was the managers disrespect that precipitated this. Our server was great!!!!

Where do I begin with the flaming f**king train wreck that is Bloomingdale's TGI Fridays? You know what.. Let's just bullet point the highlights of our dining experience tonight.. -dirty tables and floor -friend received wrong salad, never got the replacement -other friend received wrong order, they replaced it with another incorrect order.. Third try was also incorrect.. She never got her correct meal -the server SPILLED SALAD DRESSING ON MY FREND -2 friends ordered beer.. showed up AFTER the food -found bones in my salmon -vegan friend asked for no chicken in her pasta, there was chicken in her pasta  -after our meal the INITIAL replacement salad finally arrived and had a LONG BLACK HAIR in it  -ABSOLUTELY NOTHING on our bill was comped or discounted. We didn't even get an apology. I'm PISSED we had to pay for 100% for everything.  Our server avoided us for the rest of the night. I can sit here and bitch and plead for Friday's to get their act together, but let's face it.. They don't care. I'm waiting for everyone to get sick from food poisoning. Screw this place.

And i would say that this is my home! I couldn't even tell how many times I've been here and never even bother to review this place! And when i say its my home like its my Home sweet home! I always love the food and never disappoints me my drinks is always the best and the place where we sat all the time i would say is just like a couch in my home. The food is always good I've ordered probably most of them steak burger pasta. And im not sure how other people gets bad service here when i always gets the best one. Maybe im just nice or what.

This place has gotten so crappy. On occasion we get good food, rarely great so I dont know why we go back. The waitresses have been awful a few times so today we got delivery through Grub Hub. Two of our sides were missing and our 'medium' steak was raw. When we called they said call Grub Hub, there's nothing we can do. $15 for a raw steak and you can't do anything? Definitely won't ever be back there.

Don't waste your money. Food awful, service awful. Ordered from grub hub for first time and apparently they can't even read off an order ticket because the order ticket was correct we received, however none of the food was. When we called we were told the only way to fix was to come pick up new food (if I wanted to leave my house I wouldn't have ordered grub hub genius). We only received half our food and the sides werent right and they forgot the appetizers all together. I was only given the option of in store credit, as if I would eat at a place that can't read an order ticket. That screams food poisoning. I know fridays has gone in the dumps but damn my 9 year olds lemonade stand runs better than this place.

Worst service I've ever had in a restaurant. Scott Griffith was the worst manager, not only did he not try to correct the mistakes made by his training server, he also did not offer help on the floor for our party of 10. When confronted about our service, he told my friend to let him manage his own store. "If we had a problem there was manager job available if we could do better." Our whole party was in complete shock with how he interacted with our group. Even the tables next to us who were listening to the conversation were amazed that he said what he did. Will never return. Update: After all that had happened we payed our bills and were singing happy birthday to my friend, getting ready to leave. While we were singing the manager approached us again and proceeded to kick us out of the restaurant. We were so furious but left on his terms, as we were walking a different server jumped in and got in my face. When we got outside that same server followed us outside and proceeded to throw an entire cup of water into my face. I am appalled by this situation, never in my life have I seen such service. Do not go here!

Update- TGIF changed burgers- they put a thousand island sauce on them!  My friend ordered a PLAIN burger nothing on it well done, I a hamburger medium- after 25 min mine had sauce and cheese on it and well done, my friend had sauce on it.  Also you can no longer substitute broccoli instead of fries at no charge.  The manager brought the one burger we sent back and saw me scraping off cheese on mine. There was no apologies or offer to comp any part of our lunch.   We come here often for drinks and appetizers.  Loved the all you can eat deal they had.  This new deal of $5.00 is not so great.  They are not full appetizers  .  Which I'm not sure why we thought they would be anyway. The service was below par.  This guy should not be working a busy Friday night.

Came here for lunch and we were seated right away. My boyfriend and I shared a ribeye with a side of ribs. We also got a half portion of the cajun pasta. Everything was cooked well and seasoned nicely. Even though the pasta was a half portion, it had a generous amount of chicken and shrimp.  Our server was friendly and checked up on us frequently. Our waters and sodas were empty a couple times, but he did eventually notice it.  Overall, it was a nice casual place to dine. BUT, they didnt seem like they have a separate lunch menu, so lunch and dinner prices are the same. Maybe would go to a different restaurant nearby that has lunch specials for a better lunch deal.

As a veteran on Veteran's Day, I drove all the way up to TGIF restaurant in Bloomingdale based on their invitation for a complimentary veteran's meal. I arrived 5 minutes after 2pm and was informed I'm ineligible as the offer ended exactly at 2pm. The front desk lady said this was based on the manager's orders. What kind of recognition is that? They couldn't be flexible by a few minutes? I went next door to Chili's, where not only were they much more welcoming, but their complimentary meal is offered all day and evening. I was even invited to come back again for a free dinner.  I'm avoiding TGIF in the future for this unnecessary stinginess, and will now happily become a regular Chili's customer. TGIF seems to only honor veterans because they have to for public relations sake, not out of any real desire.

I've come here a few more times. 2 out of the 3 times everything has been good. The food they prepare is always good. That 1 time out of the three, the order was not placed in which the person serving us said he could bump it for me or I can cancel it so I just chose to cancel it. I appreciate that he caught his mistake quick and addressed it. I could see the look on his face in which he felt very sorry so I didn't take it as a big deal or anything.

Probably the worst service I've ever received in years. The "server" (note the quotes) was arrogant and had a nasty attitude when I made a simple request for an extra side of sauce. When I explained to their manager about this guy I was told that someone else would "deal with me." Deal with me?!? Who the heck tells a customer that?!? Do you even WANT my business?!? Apparently not! I think I will spend my Friday's elsewhere.

Stopped in Friday's on a Friday to see if they had any namesake day of the week specials. They do not, and they only have a few options available for lunch portions which is a bummer when you're looking for adequate meal portions. There was only about a dozen people here around 1pm for lunch and unfortunately it was not great service. I only have an hour to kill for lunch and the majority of my time was spent waiting. Waiting to place the order, waiting for the food (took the longest especially when you're hungry) and then waiting for the check. The worst part was our waiter rang up our $7 meals for $9 dollars and then it seemed like he disappeared as we waited around to reconcile. We did not receive an itemized receipt when he rang us up so we had to ask for one of those first to figure out why our bill was so high. Thankfully upper management was very kind enough to let us pay the correct amount and the manger personally came over to apologize. Kudos to him!! I wish our waiter would have paid attention to us though.
Awful experience I would give them 0 stars if I could. My family and I walked in and sat down and waited 20 minutes and no server came to the table. So we just walked out. Will never go back

I figured I had been bad luck on previous visits. But I guess not. Service at this location has always been slow but it seems to have gotten slower some how. And there's no excuse when the restaurant is not busy. I guess this is one of those chains that has given up. One suggestion in the mean time, don't put people with no people skills in charge or in the position of hostess. If I was just grading them the place would get no stars. Sad to see. Most aren't as bad as this one.

I still generally like Fridays but I'm done with this particular one.  Why? IT SMELLS.  It's smells BAD.   This is on top of the stench coming from the bathrooms that I've mentioned previously.  I don't know what the problem is - maybe 25+ years of being cleaned by low-paid, not-caring-about-cleaning servers? - but this place has a stench that has me thinking of a complete gut job. You'd be better off going to Anyways next door.  It's newer and smells clean.

A standard TGIFridays with a-okay food, decent service, fun cocktails, and a forgettable atmosphere. We came here for dinner and drinks with friends a few weeks ago and the place was jumpin' on a Friday night. I had a fun Long Island that had tapioca balls in it, and the $10 endless apps deal which enabled me to enjoy the all American trio of wings, potato skins, and mozzarella sticks. It was good fried fun, but nothing to write home about. Overall, a reliable place to stop for a meal or a drink with friends, but not exactly unforgettable.
waiting to hear back from corporate. people dont believe me when I tell them this happened. thats how unbelievable it is.

Best burger I've had in a very long time.  I forgot how good the burgers are at TGI..... had the bacon cheeseburger,  fries and mozz sticks for an appetizer.  Everything was really quick, I think I was in and out of there in around 30 minutes.     Only negative thing I can say about TGI's pretty much ever is that I'm not a fan of their runny big Mac sauce.  I think they call it burger sauce or Friday sauce or something like that.  I'll definitely be back here if I'm in the area again.

I love TGIF and I go to many locations. My usual "go-to" spot is the one in Rosemont but my friends and I decided to check this one out tonight. We came at around 9:30pm on a Tuesday. I ordered a smoothie and the southwestern BBQ salad (I think it's newer) and OMG I was pleasantly surprised. The smoothies are a little too sweet but still very refreshing and delicious. I've had bad experiences with salads (some I wouldn't even eat) from TGIF so I was hesitant but this one was amazing. I would highly recommend the southwestern BBQ salad for anyone who likes BBQ chicken and avocados. I tried the Mac and cheese and it was also very good. The service here took a little more time than anticipated but the server was extremely nice so we didn't really mind (she kept coming back making sure we had everything we needed- drinks, any sides, additional food, etc). Our (adult) drinks haha were also very good! This TGIF has a really large center bar which is really nice. It is clean and has a really fun, yet not too overwhelming, ambiance. Overall, despite waiting a while for the food, I really liked this location and will likely return.

It's a TGIFriday's, you basically know what you're getting yourself into coming here. It's pretty much on the same level as a Chili's or Applebee's, but I find the quality of food is slightly better, the servers work harder, plus they have daily deals and the Stripes Rewards. If I'm looking for something above a fast food place but not a fancy sit-down either, this is where you'll find me. I like their steaks and I usually order a Mojito or a Mango Mai Tai. Definitely not the best, but not bad. And I'm really glad they do BINGO nights. I love me some BINGO.
Just two questions come to mind.... Why would anyone come back here? How is this franchise still open?
Took foreverrr to get service. It was pretty busy so it was understandable. Waiter was really nice once he arrived. I ordered a pasta & it was really good
Love this location. I always sit at the bar, so I don't have to wait for seating.  Drinks are good and bar tenders are quick to fill order. Food is great,  love the burgers and salmon!

Went here for lunch one day as we had not been to Friday's in a long time! Our waiter was nice but I felt like he immediately was acting like a salesman rather than a waiter. I could tell he was on a mission to "sell" as much of the menu to us as he could. I realize there is probably pressure on him to do so, but it was kind of an immediate "turn off." We ordered the appetizer sampler which was good. I ordered the smothered chicken and spinach and my boyfriend got a jack daniel's chicken sandwich. My chicken was good but nothing too flavorful or exciting. My boyfriend liked his sandwich but you practically needed a microscope to see the chicken, it was so small! Again, our waiter came by to give us a sales pitch about dessert. Overall the experience was okay but I'd probably go to another chain next time versus Friday's. I felt like the experience lived up to the "chain experience" and was very predictable.

Ellen, the bartender, is definitely a factor between 3 and 4 stars.  If I could eat one thing everyday it would be the Jack Daniels' ribs.. if I can get a half order of them with the other JD samplers while getting a discount from the Fridays' club, then sign me up about 10 years ago.   DYK you can now "flash" the server with your coupon you get in the email interweb?  Yes, you can.

Be sure to sign up for their Earn More Stripes program.  When you show your card, they'll bring you complimentary fresh tortilla chips and salsa.  Our dinners were terrific tonight.  I splurged and ordered the Jack Daniels rib eye steak. Requested medium and received juicy and medium.  The Jack Daniels sauce was on the side in a small cup. Service was excellent.    We were attended to by a host, server and food runner .  We had a very enjoyable dinner out.

Iv'e been to this place a few times already and each time it has be exceptional. The waiters are quick and professional. They always treat you with respect and make me want to come back there.  The food is delicious ! Last time I went I had a steak with mashed potatoes and fresh vegetable medley. It was just as I expected.  Also, I love the music they play there :)

Went on a Saturday afternoon. Our waiter, Anthony, was great! Our appetizers took a while to come out - Bacon Wrapped Jalapeño Poppers & Boneless Wings were good. Ordered the Jack Daniel's Chicken Sandwich - it was so small!!! Also ordered the "Sizzling" Chicken & Spinach - when it came to the table, it looked like it was sitting in the back for awhile. Overall, great service from Anthony but food was just A-OK.

Out of the chains Fridays is one of our favorites however this location can use some improvement.   The bar area has an odor which spoils your meal.  The service is good but have noticed that the portions seem smaller.  Overall we rather not go to this store.

Fridays is Fridays, so you can usually bank on it being consistent in delivery (for food, anyways). I've been coming here since I was a wee lass and am usually content with this location.     Service is usually average with the occasional meh server or great server (Daz. [I think that's the name] is usually really good).     Food is average, though I very much enjoy the chicken fingers and honey mustard. The seasoning on their fries used to be more which I liked but still, those are decent too. The sizzling chicken and shrimp is another good one, and the French onion is usually my go-to soup if I'm feeling soup.      Recent problem I've noticed: I don't know what is up with that girls bathroom (can't speak for the lads), but it's got quite the stank going. It kind of smells like a sewer issue, and was at first confined to the bathroom but I was actually starting to notice it by the tables nearby; however, last time I was in it smelled as if they were somehow trying to deal with it.     It's of course got the whole bar portion, mixed drinks can sometimes use some help but whatever. They've got all kinds of specials on drinks as well as food (including food/appetizer combos at a good price).     Hours are 11am-2am, so that is nice if you're looking for something later on. They've got their "Stripes" card which has some decent perks if you sign up. Fridays is nothing extraordinary, but it's consistent and decent.

i have been here many times  but I have yet to get good service. Most of the time the staff is unfriendly and they seem like they only act a certain way just because they have to.  Also if you decide to get the warm brownie as a dessert make sure you tell them you want it to be warm, otherwise the kitchen doesn't really care how good they serve it to you.

I don't know if I'm a fan, per se, but we had a good enough experience that I would feel guilty only giving three stars. We only came here because my brother, sweet guy that he is, sent me a TGI Friday's gift card for my birthday. It's the sort of place he likes to eat, and little ole Goshen, IN doesn't have a lot of choices, so in this case it really is the thought that counts. We were seated promptly but in our brief seconds standing in the entrance, there did seem to be a waiting area -- albeit not a big one -- so maybe they remodeled it slightly? In any case, I didn't make anyone uncomfortable by standing next to a diner's chair. They just introduced 20 new menu items and we were given a spiel about this promotion -- order one and get a card for $10 off your next visit. Well, in looking over the entrees, there were some appealing ones, so we both went that route. Also, their "stripes" frequent diner program offers, it turns out, free chips and salsa on every visit. Random, but hey, why not? We went for nachos, I got Mediterranean chicken skewers, and the husband got a burger. The nachos are served "tostada style" which is kind of funny, since this is how nachos were originally made: cheese and jalapeno on each chip. These also have beans on them, and are served with a pile of lettuce, salsa and guacamole. Pretty tasty, you can't screw these up too badly. My Mediterranean chicken skewers were a  nice find: two skewers of garlicky-lemony chicken chunks with onions, served over rice, with veggies (squash/zucchini), tzatziki sauce and pita.  The chicken was tender and flavorful, the rice was tasty and the pita was warm and soft. The tzatziki was not quite perfect, but it still tasted good.  I swear, the wait staff in this place must take happy pills or something, because everyone was exceptionally cheerful. Which is nice, if a little disconcerting. I know, they're paid to cheerlead their food, so good for them. Our waitress checked back plenty, got us refills promptly and was all around great.  So even though I would choose Anyway's (right next door) over Friday's about 95% of the time, I still have to give this place four stars, for doing what it did well and cheerfully.

We ordered the Potato Skins for an appetizer, they came out horribly, cant imagine how 2 different people touch this before we did and didnt smell the charred stench of burning bacon ,cheese, and potato! I was kind of scared to reorder but the 2nd batch was better......everything else was fairly decent besides the service.....our waitress seemed as if we upset her by asking if they sold them burnt all the time........
Love this Friday's!  We have been to many TGI Friday's as a family. This location is my favorite. We always get good service and it's always fast as well. Can't beat the jack chicken appetizer!

I normally like TGI Friday's, but I don't know what it is about this one I have had two horrible experiences. The waitresses are incompetent, one took the plates away and took half of my $8 drink with the dirty dishes. When I asked for a new one since she basically dumped $4 down the drain, she charged me for a whole new one. The second time for whatever reason the bartender was our waiter and we were stuck waiting for drinks and our food for 20 minutes both times. The only thing the managers offer to compensate is a free dessert. No thanks. I wont be back here again.

Their plastic glasses that the ice water comes in... make the best noise when you stir your straw in the water. Yep, I'm kinda weird. But I really do love that noise for some reason. Anywho. Friday's is one of those places that you can go to and you know you won't be disappointed, but you're not gonna be super stoked either. It's Friday's.  You should probably check out their new Yucatan chicken salad, it was pretty good. Use the lime they give you on it, it makes it. And you probably want to ask for extra avocado because I barely had any on my salad. Otherwise I typically order the dragon fire chicken, love the jasmine rice that comes with this. Drinks, I typically go with the Patron cosmo rita shaker. But they have new drinks pretty often so I'll try those every now and then. I bet you didn't know, but you can order a cup of dirt for dessert! Do it!

After coming here for years this was the worst service / food I have ever seen at a fridays.  Stopped in for dinner with my two kids. And between the waitress not coming up for a half hour while she was busy talking at her friends table to forgetting my kids soup to getting our drinks after the appetizer came up. Asked for the manager his only answer was what do you want me to do  and if I want a gift card.  NO.  I JUST WANTED THE SERVICE I PAID FOR.
For a Friday's, food is decent but I've always had service issues here. I'd actually give this restaurant 2.5 stars if it was an option.

Went in last Thursday to meet a friend for a drink. We had an extremely friendly waiter. A tall young gentleman who was nothing but smiles. We did not eat but the service we receive from him was great.

My family and I visited 3/5/2017, at 5pm we were seated very quickly. Our server Courtney Was excellent and he was very attentive, considering he seemed to be taking care of many tables. My main issue was that there were four girls standing in the front where you would wait to be seated who could have done more to help how busy the establishment was, other than take pictures on their phones, talk about their weekend, text, and take up space. I feel that the use of their time could have been better, especially since their were many patrons after us waiting to be  seated. Other than that the experience was ok. Kudos to our server for busting his butt to make sure his tables were well taken care of.

I came in on Saturday night with one other person. I ordered the mozzarella sticks and a bowl of cheese and broccoli soup, my friend ordered the Cajun pasta. I requested my soup come with my friend's meal. When the server arrived with the Cajun pasta he told me the kitchen was out of soup and asked if I wanted to see the menu to order something else. That's ridiculous waiting so long to tell me that my order can't be filled - if I ordered something else my friend would be done by the time my order was ready.  Also the restaurant wasn't busy by any means and we were our server's only table and he was still super slow with refills.  Going to avoid this location from now on, the service is pretty terrible.

The food was okay, but 3 out of 4 orders were messed up. When we arrived, we were greeted wonderfully by the host who brought us to our table and took out drink orders. In the middle of our orders, the manager came over to interrupt him and pull him away. She seemed very rude. Our waitress finally came, also unfriendly, and took our orders. The food took about 45 minutes to come out, and when it did, my salad had avocado on which I requested it made without, and my mother and grandmother were missing the avocado on their avocado BLT. Like I said, food was okay but the service was lacking.
The review I left for TGI Fridays was NOT for TGI but for another restaurant. No idea how it was attached to TGI. Sorry. TGI is great!

So, my +1 INSISTED on dining at either TGI Friday's or Chili's.  Being that this was the closer of the two, I begrudgingly obliged..   I was pretty shocked to see it so packed; then again, I think there was a game on AND they had $3 Long Islands.. As a pretty staunch ovo-pescetarian, I had a hard time finding seafood or veggie entrees on the menu.  That was pretty surprising to me that chains such as TGI's haven't caught up to the shift of the more health-conscious consumer. The only options that I could locate were seafood pasta or a Black Bean Burger, so I had the latter.  The burger was just OK - kind of flavorless. The burger itself crumbled apart, while the rest of the goop on top (sauce, pickles) slid off.  There was a point when half of my burger was so disassembled that I couldn't get it back together and resorted to eating it with a knife and fork.   Bleh. Our server, Brian, was nice and attentive, but seemed overwhelmed with the amount of tables he had to cover.  He did check on us while he was whizzing on by.  (And I hope my +1 gave him a good tip!)  I did have a gross green floater in my water glass, but he took care of it pretty promptly and apologized for it.  He was also good about getting refills to us without us having to ask. While I understand the "comfort" in chains, I think there are better options in the area.
They currently have a full rack of ribs entree for $10. Pretty tasty for the price. They also provide free complimentary chips. Minus one star for lack of Pokestops in the area

The night started off fine as I took a seat at the bar. And then it went downhill from there. I spent the night watching one bartender flirt and serve his friends that obviously worked here. Another that served everyone around me. My friend had to beg to get a beer. And our appetizer plates sat in front of us for over an hour and a half with no one asking if we wanted anything more. Maybe being seated would have been better, but I will definitely not be doing the bar scene again, or recommending it to anyone.

For the last time our take out order has been screwed up after driving 5 miles to this location.  When I called to talk to the manager, I explained that I had to call three times because the order taker couldn't hear me with all of the background noise.  Even after repeating my order, my husband and I only received one entree and no extra sauce for the appetizer.  Both were cold and soggy.  I had stated that we we're going to bring the food back and ask for a refund because - so furious that this happened again - I said we weren't going to pay for this "shit," but the manager hung up on me because I said a baaaaad cuss word.  I tried to call back and apologize for swearing at the manager, but good business common sense told him to take the phone off the hook.  We probably saved others the same frustration by not being able to place an order. Beware... quality control and customer service does not exist at the TGIF Bloomingdale, IL location!

There was a time when I truly enjoyed TGI Fridays.  It's never tried to be haute cuisine but the drinks were dependable, burgers and steaks were good and service was customer focused.  I stopped patronizing TGI Fridays as the food and beverage started on a downward spiral.  I found myself starving for a decent lunch last week, popped in for strawberry lemonade and the roast beef dipped.  I had to send back the lemonade that tasted like flavored water.  The waiter was very accommodating and admitted that the mix was off and he was so glad he'd fixed it before they got really busy.  I ordered a coke.  The main event arrived and I'm not sure what kind of roast beef it was, or where it was cut from.  I don't know what makes lesser cuts of roast beef collect that rainbow glisten (know what I mean?). It was a half notch above Arby's.  It was pitiful.  The fries were good, so was the Coke and service was pleasant, but I'm done, stick me with the Friday's fork.  Any kitchen sending out that sorry excuse for roast beef is suspect.  It gets two stars because the service was good!

I have never been a big fan of Friday's, but there is not much in our area as far as really good restaurants.  So we decided to try Friday's on a whim.  I was surprised.  The food was well prepared and tasted good, the service was friendly and treated us well, they have decent prices, so I would say this is a winner for the Bloomingdale area.  Their Jack Daniels' bbq sauce is super and one of my favorites.  Their pretzel appetizer is really good too.

We eat here about once a week. Jeremy was our server years ago and since then has become such a good friend. His service is seriously beyond what youd expect at TGI Fridays...he should be at wildfire serving.  Dont think we've had bad food or service here...sure foods been messed up but they fix it without any issues, i mean it happens. Seems like you go to expensive places to eat and the food is not good you stick to the small cheaper places and have an enjoyable time. Recommened!

I normally prefer not to eat at chain restaurants what with all the unique offerings in illinois but I was in a hurry and wanted a steak and some french onion and the nearest place was this one. Here's what I got: French Onion (3.15): Good lord this bastard was salty. It looked really damn good (see picture) when I got it but when I uncovered the oozy cheese and crouton, there was this thick (and I mean maple syrup thick)  dark, syrupy substance in it with chunks of onion. It was basically a black gravy There is no way this is the standard recipe for tgi fridays. I probably got a rare f-up where they left a pot of french onion on and it condensed to this thick salty crap. It was WAY too salty, and this is coming from a guy that likes Ramen and olive garden. If you've had a similar experience, let me know so I can complain to their HQ.  I ended up using the soup as gravy for my mashed potatoes haha. It worked well.  Petite Steak: Cooked surprising well considering my appetizer, I asked for medium, I got a perfect pink medium. It comes with a dollop of this rich garlic butter. If you're into garlic, this little ball will make your meal. I even dipped my fries in it. I also asked for a side of Jack daniels sauce which I suspect has no Jack Daniels in it. It was very sweet and syrupy. (11.00) (See Picture) Comes with 2 sides:  I got the seasoned fries which were crispy and good, and the mashed potatoes which were also pretty darn good. Service was good, soup came in 15 minutes of sitting, Steak and sides came 15 minutes later.    Now unlike some chain hating snob faces on Yelp, I don't have some stupid bias against chain restaurants. I take them as they are: salty, consistent, and reasonably priced.  This was was no different with the weird exception of the soup. Would I come here again? Probably, but not unless I really had to. Maybe I'll try a different location.

Its ur typical Friday's but if they're specialty is not right, then its not special @ all! Was craving a bbq burger & decided to come here & order a JD burger instead. Since I havnt had it in years, I was expecting the sauce to be, well, saucy. But watery as it was, I poured it on my burger & it jus flowed thru my whole plate. It soaked up my stale burger bun & fries & added to the disappointment. The first step to a gud burger is s gud bun & this 1 was definitely not. Totally ruined my whole burger smashin' vibe with its dryness. Maybe if I go back on "FRIDAY" it'll b better cuz they certainly cudnt get it right this Tuesday.

if i could give this place -10 stars,i would. they gave my friends and i such a hassle that we ended up leaving. the servers and manager were rude & treated us with a very hostile attitude. horrible service - we waited 20 minutes to be seated by a rude young girl. I would rather eat my arm off than attempt eat at any T.G.i. friday's again!!! the food is terrible anyway, it was just the only thing close and open that night.

Well the endless appetizer commercials sucked us in and we ended up here after a long weekend bike ride.  We grabbed seats in the bar area and immediately starting checking out the drink menu. The tap list isn't very large but they did have a few good craft beers.   We each ordered an unlimited appetizer - boneless buffalo wings and loaded potato skins. They were good but I don't know that we really ordered enough to get our money's worth out of the whole deal.  We did get to take the extras home so that was nice.  And our server was great.  But I don't think I would go in for that deal again.

Have price apps, and endless apps are why I come here.  Service is usually good here.  Sitting at the bar can be hit or miss with good service.., but makes sense I'd highly recommend the spinach dip and strawberry cheesecake milkshake. It is alcoholic and its amazing

Came here with my mom for a bite to eT and a drink for my bday on a Thursday night... Everything was fresh and perfect, specially the service who were very helpful and understanding of my gluten sensitivity. When it was time for desert I got a nice ice cream scoop with a candle. That was a nice touch (I wish I remembered our girls' name) she was awesome! The only downer is that the place needs some updating, it smelled old where we sat.

I brought two babies in for lunch with my mom. The hostess was great, opened the door for us, smiled and was friendly. Our server had an attitude,  she rolled her eyes at us the minute we walked in the door. The attitude just continued after that. She was slow to take our drink order and just slow the entire time. Her name was Lauren. It's not like the babies were fussy, they we're extremely well behaved. I even picked up the food they dropped on the floor. The food was good though.

The service could be better, especially when it comes to to go.  The food also could have been better.  The steak looked like it came out of a comedy where it was dropped and just placed in the to go box without a care.  I'm not saying this is what happened but the texture of the steak after one bite made me want to gag.  I don`t think I'll be coming back.  Plus my stomach hurt a lot after eating their food.

CAJUN SHRIMP AND CHICKEN PASTA. That's all my boyfriend and I ever order here. The spinach dip-- bomb. Their long islands-- perfect. You can never taste the alcohol, but you will most definitely feel it. And the customer service has always been painless. Haven't had a bad experience here yet, and I've been coming here once or twice a month for the past two years!

Scott Griffith should not be manager... I ordered a drink and the bartenders completely forgot about me.. I asked for the bar manager and was greeted by Scott Griffith himself. Right off the bat, I felt marginalized and harassed.. He dropped a gaze that spoke ulterior motives.. this was not to my appeal to which I then asked for my check. Additionally, the duration of which I waited for my check was impeccable and I knew that this was inevitable due to how the services were functioning prior to this fiasco. I left dumbfounded, belittled, and with no alcohol in my bloodstream. Scott Griffith should NOT be manager.

We went here for a family dinner today and they seemed to have a hard time getting my order right. First my drink came out in a badly cracked glass. Then I ordered soup as an appetizer and a burger with NO onion for my meal. Our servers switched midway through our meal. It took a long time to get served and they forgot my soup. They brought it out halfway through my main meal. My burger had onions and my potatoes had those little green onion things on top. I didn't even wanna deal with trying to get it corrected by that point so I picked them off but could still taste onion on my burger. My stomach got a bit upset. It was frustrating for me but everyone else in our party seemed to be fine with their meals.

Just another update since my last review - came with family week of Labor Day. Let me get the major complaint out of the way FIRST, and we do realize this may not be specifically with THIS Friday's alone. ** Friday's Nachos (regular nachos) have been 'discontinued'.  Major bummer.  The Friday's Nachos have basically been a regular staple of the restaurant since literally the late 80's.  We asked a manager about this and he had no idea why, but that it had been finalized earlier in the year.  We actually contacted corporate with this question and have yet to receive an answer (I doubt we will).  They now have - instead - some type of "chicken nachos" for about 12.99.  General rule of thumb:  You don't fix something that isn't broken after almost three decades.  Also, if for some reason the 'regular nachos' were no longer doing well, it's highly doubtful the chicken nachos will suddenly fair better. - Our overall service was actually fantastic.  Our waiter (Bryan? African American guy) was being trained and he was beyond attentive, as was his trainer.  A+ on service tonight. - Food was very good.  Prices have gone up a tad on just about everything, but I guess this is to be expected. - One final note:  Over the years, the restaurant has obviously been remodeled MULTIPLE times.  We noticed the 2nd floor section (back of restaurant) now seemed to be painted/wall-papered with some very dull, plain, boring beige-ish /green-ish paint or wall-paper.  It's hard to explain unless you see it.  It was never that way before so this must have been recently done.  Just no vibe to it and it actually takes away from the upbeat atmosphere of that section now, almost brings you down if you keep looking at it - it is just so DRAB.  Again hard to explain, but whoever decided on THIS made a bad decision. Overall:  Good food, great service this time around.  Removing a classic staple from the menu (again probably not relegated to this Friday's alone) was a BAD MOVE, and some of the remodeling with this restaurant just is out in left field...   We will be back, but as stated in my previous reviews we only get here maybe 1-2 times a year on average.

$10 all you can eat appetizers deal is on! Came here and found this sweet deal. I usually get the appetizers anyways, so this was pretty good.  They have the usual: boneless wings, green bean fries, mozzarella sticks, BBQ chicken flatbread, dumplings, and I think that was it. Everything was delicious! Especially the parmesan garlic boneless wings!   The service started out good, but then later, our server stopped coming by our table to serve us water and for our next choice of appetizers. He forgot our orders a few times as well. Service could have been better.  The greeter in the front was nice and friendly. He helped my friend charge his phone at the "back office". He was worried and kept telling my friend that he has no control over his phone because it is in the back and many of the staff goes back there. Nothing was stolen.

I did the endless apps and waited 35 minutes for the first round of food to come out. I placed the order for the second one and it took 25 more minutes. Not once did the server say sorry for the wait so I'm guessing this is the normal speed of service.
Perfect amount of food served here.  I have liked every dish,  from pasta, sandwiches, ribs,  salads ..... Friendly staff and prompt service. Nice, comfortable atmosphere. Come join us.
Spent 55 minutes without any food while all other tables were eating.  Waiter apologized but food still never came. Left without eating.  Never would Coke to this location again.

I went to this TGIF's two weeks ago and it was over an hour wait (with tons of people there waiting).  We decided not to wait and left.   I decided I would go again tonight.  It's a Saturday night and we were arriving at 5:40.  I called around 5:20 to see if they took a reservation for 2 adults and 5 kids.  They told me they don't take reservations but that they were not crowded.  I arrived 15 minutes later and there was no one waiting to be seated.   They told me it was going to be an hour wait and that they had a reservation of 15 coming.   First, they told me they do not take reservation, second there was no one waiting.   How was it an hour wait?!?!   I walked out and will NEVER go back to this TGIF's again.

I had not been here in a long time. The place is always so busy. So we called ahead for a carry out order. I gave them an hour notice on a 15 minute preparation time order. When I arrived they had not started the order yet. So I ended up waiting a long time. I was not happy but added a tip to the credit card receipt anyway. They never charged the tip to my account so they must not have even looked at it. On a positive note the food was incredible! And the server was very nice. My wife ordered a regular cheeseburger with bacon and she said it was good. But I ordered a newer item on their menu called the Smoked Stack Burger. It was so good I could hardly believe it. It was cooked to perfection and the Beer-braised sausage & onions, Asiago & cheddar between two fresh hickory-smoked burgers with sweet Memphis seasoning, melted sharp cheddar, Tennessee BBQ sauce, BBQ ranch aioli, applewood-smoked bacon and coleslaw was outstanding! I will not be waiting a long time this time before I return again! YUM!!!

We ordered take out and they said it would be 20 minutes. We got there on time yet had to wait forever at the bar to receive the food. The thing that bothered me the most is that the food was very, very cold and tasted like it was yesterday's leftovers! Wtf! I used to love Friday's but after this experience NEVER AGAIN!

My wife ordered a ribeye and it was so tough that it wouldn't cut with a steak knife. We are Reward Members but I don't know for how much longer. If you pay $19.00 for a steak you should be able to enjoy it. Very disappointing!!!

I went here last night to have dinner with my cousin. Wait time was perfect. I wanted to order an "endless appetizer". Keep in mind there are only two of us. This server tells me that if I order an "endless appetizer" that I cannot share it and we both have to pay $10.00 each for an appetizer. So you are going to babysit me while I eat to make sure I don't share my appetizer with someone at my table? If this sounds reasonable to ANYONE on the planet then you should go live on mars! So instead I saved us the $20 and just ordered an appetizer... the potato skins. Man did they suck. No flavor at all. Tasted like cardboard. I ate two of them just to make sure they were as flavorless as I thought.  To add insult to injury, at least twice the food runners kept trying to serve out table appetizers that were not ours. This happened three times (not kidding). We saw mozzarella sticks, some kind of chicken wings, and some quesillias ... oh ya and some pot stickers .... Maybe other stuff I just stopped paying attention to the idiocy at that point. I followed up my order with the sizzling chicken and cheese. Once again ... a very bland dish. I was here a few weeks ago with another friend and my steak at the time tasted exactly like the chicken I had last night. How is that even possible? This place use to have excellent food. The prices have gone up and the quality is in the toilet. My guest had a coupon to use for a free burger but a point was made that the turkey burger was excluded from the coupon but the manager allowed the transaction anyway. Oh wow another rule ... like kindergarten? Management forces employees to repeat this ridiculousness to paying customers?  Two stars because our server was nice and part of his job is repeating these moronic guidelines, which he clearly felt were completely wack (you could tell by the look of shame he gave while explaining it) Food, stupid rules, and, micromanaging your customers (not your employees?) are going to be why this chain eventually disappears just like applebees and bakers square. Same review is on google. Go eat somewhere else. Olive Garden is down the street and they have free wine.

As a fridays member I get free chips and salsa... yum. ..they have great drink specials everyday. .. on Thursday there are 3 dollar long islands, margaritas, and mojitos....also 5 dollar appetizers on Sunday to Thursday.  D J plays on Thursdays. .. fun atmosphere,  friendly service,  food is always great! I personally live the jack Daniels chicken.

I was not allowed to order the food and drinks I wanted here because I am handicapped and could not access the bar, so the manager told me she could not accommodate me and my order! This is discrimination! U have to be physically able to go up the stairs to the bar, to order the specials! That is just wrong! I won't ever go to this location again! I'm sure there are laws against this!

Just had dinner with a couple friends at TGI Friday's and we had an amazing night out. Our server Jeremy gave us exceptional service. He recommended us a variety of great food and drink options. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. When I return I will definitely be requesting Jermey he was very personable and had our table cracking up the whole time. It was so great so have such an interactive server, haven't had that in a very long time.

My husband and I are Stripes members and we really like the free chips and salsa we get every time we go. We are new to this area and we were very excited about being so close to a TGIF. The food is decent; we haven't had to complain about that. The service is a different story. The first time we came here the service was fine. Since then it's been downhill. Servers have forgotten to bring multiple parts of our dinner and even almost refused to bring us what we ordered. The worst was when a black waiter was barely serving our table and a table across the aisle from us (another white couple) and giving all his attention and time to a black couple near us (who said that they had never had such good service before). Meanwhile, the couple across the aisle from us didn't even get their drinks and my husband barely got the sides to his meal. I'm sorry to write this, but we couldn't believe how we were treated. I think we will be back at TGIF, but probably patronize other locations.

Walked in to find my shoes sticking to the floor.  Sat down with 4 others at a table and 4 of the 5 chairs were missing a piece of the chair which made them wobble.  We opened the first piece of silverware and it was missing the fork.  At that point we just left.

TGI Friday's is not as good anymore as I used to think it was when I was younger. Their burgers and other entrees are alright, but nothing special and overpriced because of that. However, one thing I do really enjoy on my trips is their brownie. That is amazing, and we have in the past sometimes just decided to get dinner elsewhere and come here for dessert. The service at this location and the pace of the meal has been really slow every time we visit.

Lets start with the drink, Diet Coke tasted flat or like bar pop.  Had a simple wing order 1/2 buffalo 1/2 garlic Parmesan.  The wings tasted like  dried up unfresh chicken nuggets with barely any sauce on them. It was  also cold in there, the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because the French onion soup was pretty good.
Totaling screwed up out take out order. Had no idea what was on the menu. Talked to the manager did not seem to care.

I decided to eat at the TGIF in Bloomingdale IL this afternoon and was extremely disappointed. I made sure to let the chef know that the food was terrible and I would not be coming back. As I am a cook at a Rock Bottom restaurant i felt I had to voice my opinion to him. The Steak I ordered to be cooked well done was definitely not. I suspect that they don't even check their meats by temperature as they should and have had complaints in the past seeing as how the waitress who brought my food had to ask me to cut the steak and check it. I choked on the macaroni I ordered as a side because whatever they put on top was overly heated and was visibly burnt. I could have just scraped off the topping and eaten the macaroni but I would have probably chipped a tooth and choked on that as well. It's one thing that one macaroni side was in that condition but my wife's was as well. I would go on with what was wrong with the food but I feel that who ever reads this will get the point. Extremely disappointed and will never eat at a TGIF ever again. I suggest you take your money somewhere else. Old country buffet has better service and food than this place.

It's time to kick up TGI Fridays with a third star. They aren't phenomenal, but the staff seems to have gotten better. I like being treated to free food with their Stripes program so that's gotta count for something. For a chain restaurant, they are fine. Middle of the road - at least you know what you're gonna get - it could definitely be worse. I know this isn't a ringing endorsement, but the restaurant is clean, the food will fill you up and the staff was engaged on my last visit. If you're in the area and want a meal without any surprises, this might be a fine option for you.

Lousy food, lousy service and a lousy attitude.  Three strikes and we will never return.  My sandwich was so overcooked that I could hardly chew it.  An order for a drink was forgotten, then forgotten again.  The young server, who had never checked on us to see how our food was, rolled his eyes at us indignantly when we complained.  Someone, who we think was a manager, came by to apologize and said in a thick accent that he would come back and give us a complimentary something (could not understand him).  Despite the fact that he walked past our table a few times later on, he never stopped to say a word to us.  The server dropped off our check (full price) without a word. We had not been here for a while and there is no reason to return.

Quick stop at 10pm since everywhere was closed.  Good ol' TGI never lets me down.  Waitress was excellent, seemed to be the only one working besides a manager maybe.  We were one of maybe three tables so I could understand.  Food I always seem to like, they got some new burgers in which i devoured, left a fatty tip and off to the freezing cold i went.  Thanks.

I've enjoyed Fridays since I was introduced to it when moving here from the Detroit area nearly 30 years ago.  Can it really be that long?  Anyway, my two favorite appetizers are the tostados nachos and the potstickers.  I LOVE their potstickers, and have to say that I think they are better than most I can get in any Chinese restaurant.   Service was prompt and cheerful -- ask for Zach if you go...
Always good service, and good food. Never really had any problems other then the fact I had received the wrong drink (which was fixed instantly). Will go back often =]

As far as Friday's go, this one is pretty average. Our service here this past Saturday evening was really good, though, so this 4 stars goes out to our waitress, Lauren. We had 6 adults and a 2yr old. Even though the restaurant was pretty full at 530p on a Saturday, they were able to seat us quickly. So the seating wasn't the best ever - they squished 2 small tables together by the bathrooms and the beverages. But at least there were less patrons around to get pegged by whatever my nephew felt like throwing (crayons, green bean fries, etc.) And it wasn't smelly like I expected that corner to be - which tells me they keep this location clean. And really, the service was great, between my family members' indecisiveness and my rambunctious nephew - our waitress handled us really really well. And the baby loved everyone singing Happy Birthday to Grandpa :) We also appreciated the benches outside in the shade while we let our stomachs rest before driving again. p.s. Can I have another Mandarin Dreamsicle Alcoholic Shake, please?

Stopped in for lunch. I had the rather expensive Bacon Bleu steak with shrimp scampi and she had the bleu burger. All proteins were over cooked. Our server was decent but the food quality would keep us away.

I like how they changed their menu so that some things are cheaper. The environment is a barish type but also family friendly, so bring the kids to eat too! They have a variety of things on their menu that is sure to please anyone you're with. Parking is a little tight on the weekends, so get there early and you should be fine. I like the petite sirloin deal mmm steak

This place is good, not extraordinary.  Portion sizes are pretty large, and the food is usually brought out relatively quickly once you're seated.  Tends to be very busy on Friday/Saturday night. This is a good place for kids, and they tend to be very accommodating to special requests.
I love the passion fruit red bull drink, i usually have it along with the chicken & shrimp cajun pasta. Good stuff

I am in love with their Grilled Chicken and Shrimp.  Their steak is pretty good... and their ribs... My favorite of the "brand name" "date" restaurants. They have a smoking section, which puts me off. Staff is the standard teenage/early 20s crowd.
Twice I went to this location and not once they included my order for my Stripes Rewards. Why advertise it if your waiters never bother to apply those points?

food was good but I ordered the chicken and scrimp but the waiter only brought me out the chicken and told me the scrimp would be comming right out however after nearly finishing my meal the waiter returned and said oh you still haven;t got your scrimp then finally they brought it to me after I had finished everything else not to happy with the service although the food was good which is why I'm giving it only 3 stars

Similar to the other TGIFs but I have noticed a more inexperienced waitstaff.   The last few times servers were in training and once the manager on duty brought us our food. Great place to get an after work drink and have a late night menu.

I will be the first to say I'm not the biggest fan of the Friday's menu.  However, we have friends who love to come here and are part of the Stripes program, so we go with them sometimes.  The servers make the experience.  Far from the "30 pieces of flair" from Office Space, they seem genuinely cool people, the kind you want to buy a drink for and sit around talking about life.  Every server I've had has been conscious of my food allergies, to the point of substituting amaretto for something else in the drink specials.  We usually have our baby with us, and there is no problem getting her a high chair or making room for her car seat carrier.  A lot of the menu choices aren't my favorites, but the steaks and drinks are pretty good.  Desserts could use a LOT of work but it's not their fault, it's corporate.

I prefer Friday's to places like Applebee's and other similar competitors. I think their food is slightly better. This location (like others in the area) gets very crowded. There just aren't a huge amount of dinner restaurant choices in the Bloomingdale/Hanover Park area. Anyway, service is decent, I had a good experience, so I'd recommend it.
